block.p: Joanne Jane Wang, the daughter of Julia and Dong-Ping Wang of Stony Brook, N.Y., was married yesterday to David Warner Golann, a son of Jan F. Golann and Steven W. Golann of New York. The Rev. Dr. Paul Sorrentino, a minister of the Conservative Congregational Christian Conference, performed the ceremony at Three Village Church in East Setauket, N.Y.
The bride and bridegroom, both 24, met at Amherst, from which they graduated.

Joanne Jane Wang, the daughter of Julia and Dong-Ping Wang of Stony Brook, N.Y., was married yesterday to David Warner Golann, a son of Jan F. Golann and Steven W. Golann of New York. The Rev. Dr. Paul Sorrentino, a minister of the Conservative Congregational Christian Conference, performed the ceremony at Three Village Church in East Setauket, N.Y.
The bride and bridegroom, both 24, met at Amherst, from which they graduated.

Mrs. Golann is a research assistant in the Community College Research Center at Teachers College at Columbia University in New York. She received a master's degree in social sciences from the University of Chicago.
Her father is a professor of oceanography at the State University of New York at Stony Brook.

Mr. Golann is an editorial assistant at R. A. Rapaport Publishing, a publisher of consumer health magazines in New York. He received a master's degree in American literature from Cambridge University in England.

His mother is a coordinator in the retail department at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York, and is a member of the vestry at St. James' Episcopal Church in New York. His father is a partner in Dalton Strategic Partnership, a London investment management firm; he manages the firm's New York office.
